meanings.definition: To establish or set in position
meanings.sent1: She was instating the new rules at the office.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was instating the students in their assigned seats.
meanings.sent3: The cat was instating itself as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun instating its dominance over the sky.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was instating the plants in neat rows.

meanings.definition: To put into effect or operation
meanings.sent1: The manager was instating the new policy for employee breaks.
meanings.sent2: The team was instating the plan for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The clown was instating a new rule that everyone had to wear silly hats.
meanings.sent4: The music instating a sense of calm in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef was instating a new menu for the restaurant.
